page.title: 09Farming (3)
page.content: Hayes Farm (arable, 170 acres) on clay loam grows wheat, barley and peas. The barley is winter-sown, harvested mid- July and shipped directly to Poland, being earlier than their harvest. The straw is baled and taken away. Also, 15 acres of old pasture land are being used for supplying turves, on a once- off contract. The turf company is upgrading the pastures over 3 years, and when the turves have been removed the farmer will replant with wheat. He grows pumpkins & squashes organically on 4 acres (using mushroom manure and hand and mechanical hoeing) for his health food shops. Over 5 years he has repaired a very deep drain under a hedge/ditch so curing wet patches; the tile drainage under every field has been replaced by plastic pipes (with perforated holes) laid 4-5 ft deep every 22 yards across the fields.
